ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 189
ygData.msgSnippet: No he is write you always give buffs to everybody going on dragon raids or Plane Raids, at least that s my experience. At level 50 my DE Necro has 824 hp
ygData.messageBody:
No he is write you always give buffs to everybody going on dragon raids or
Plane Raids, at least that's my experience. At level 50 my DE Necro has 824
hp unfbuffed with equipment on. I can get that upt to 980 or so by myself.
If you get a cleric in your group I get up to 1500 easy.

Naeeldar K'Valle Dark Elf Necromancer of the 50th Level

-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin Neal <kevin@...>
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 4:12 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Digest Number 189


>From: "Kevin Neal" <kevin@...>
>
>Not neccisarily. Why put buffs on a character that doesn't need them? I
>mean, wouldn't you save mana to buff those who need it? Like tanks and
>such? However, you could get someone to buff you, letting them know that
>means you can work much more efficiently with the nice lifetap, manastone,
>lifetap, manastone process. Well....that was till we got nerfed :(-.
>
>Manueal
>
>
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Dicey" <dicey@...>
>To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>

>Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Digest Number 189
